com.radiotelescope.security

Class SecurityConfiguration

  • com.radiotelescope.security.SecurityConfiguration

  • public class SecurityConfiguration

    Specifies security details specific to the application. Extends the WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SecurityConfiguration(org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationProvider authenticationProvider, IUserRepository userRepo, Profile profile, JWTConfiguration jwtConfiguration)
      Specifies security details specific to the application. Extends the WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void configure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http)
      Configure the applications endpoints, specifically in regards to the endpoints involved with Spring Security.
      void configure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.authentication.builders.AuthenticationManagerBuilder auth)
      Override of the WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter.configure method that specifies the AuthenticationProvider to use.
      org.springframework.web.cors.CorsConfigurationSource corsConfigurationSource()
      Allows for CORS requests to be made to the API endpoints

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecurityConfiguration

                             IUserRepository userRepo,

        Specifies security details specific to the application. Extends the WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter class

        Parameters:
        authenticationProvider - the Spring Security AuthenticationProvider
        profile - the application enum Profile
        authenticationProvider - the Spring Security AuthenticationProvider

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http)

        Configure the applications endpoints, specifically in regards to the endpoints involved with Spring Security.

        If the application is running in production, it will require that all requests happen over HTTPS.

      • configure

        public void configure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.authentication.builders.AuthenticationManagerBuilder auth)

        Override of the WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter.configure method that specifies the AuthenticationProvider to use.

      • corsConfigurationSource

        public org.springframework.web.cors.CorsConfigurationSource corsConfigurationSource()

        Allows for CORS requests to be made to the API endpoints
